bestTime.question: What is the best time of year for sailing in Phuket?
bestTime.answer: November to April offers the calmest seas and most reliable weather — this is peak season for Phuket sailing. Low season (May–October) brings 30–40% lower prices and quieter anchorages. Phuket sailing works year-round with the right route. We'll always recommend the best itinerary for your exact travel dates.

catamaranVsSailing.question: Is a catamaran better than a sailing yacht in Phuket?
catamaranVsSailing.answer: Catamarans offer more space and stability — ideal for families and larger groups. Sailing yachts deliver a more authentic sailing feel and excellent value for couples or small groups. The right choice depends on your group size, comfort preferences, and the onboard atmosphere you want.

recommendedNights.question: How many nights do you recommend for the best Phuket sailing experience?
recommendedNights.answer: We recommend 5 nights minimum. That's when you can comfortably reach quieter, more rewarding destinations like Koh Rok, Koh Ha, and the Butang Islands / Koh Lipe — places significantly less crowded than Phi Phi Islands and Phang Nga Bay.

familyFriendly.question: Are Phuket sailing charters suitable for families with children?
familyFriendly.answer: Yes. We recommend stable catamarans, plan routes with calm protected swim stops, and pace the itinerary to suit your group. Our crew is experienced with family charters — and children typically say it's the best holiday they've ever had.

romantic.question: Is sailing in Phuket good for couples and romantic getaways?
romantic.answer: Absolutely. Sunset sails, quiet overnight anchorages, and privacy in beautiful places make Phuket sailing one of the most romantic holiday experiences available. For honeymoons, anniversaries, or proposals, tell us early — we'll help plan something special.

soloTravelers.question: Can solo travelers book without renting a full private yacht?
soloTravelers.answer: Yes. Cabin Cruises Phuket let you book by the cabin — a private space on a shared sailing cruise to the best islands, including Phi Phi, Koh Lanta, Koh Rok, and Racha Islands. The best-value way to experience multi-day Phuket sailing.

whatsIncluded.question: What's included in a crewed sailing charter in Phuket?
whatsIncluded.answer: Crewed charters typically include the vessel, professional crew, all meals, drinking water, fuel, safety equipment, and standard water activities. Extras like drinks, national park fees, and special setups are confirmed upfront — no hidden charges.

bareboatLicense.question: Do I need a sailing license for a bareboat charter in Phuket?
bareboatLicense.answer: Yes. Bareboat charters require a valid sailing license and demonstrated experience on a comparable vessel. If you're unsure whether you qualify, we're happy to advise — or recommend a crewed charter instead.

chooseItinerary.question: Can you help us choose the best Phuket sailing itinerary?
chooseItinerary.answer: Yes — it's one of the most valuable things we offer. Share your dates, number of nights, group size, and priorities (snorkeling, remote islands, beaches, adventure). We'll recommend a realistic route tailored to the season and designed to give your group the best possible experience.

intro.title: Premium Catamaran Charters in Phuket, Thailand

section1.title: Private Sailing Experiences Designed for Space, Stability & Comfort
section1.p1: A catamaran gives you something no speedboat or standard yacht can match: a wide, stable platform with expansive deck space, private ensuite cabins, and a flat ride with no heeling or rolling — ideal for families, first-timers, and anyone who wants to relax rather than brace.

whyCatamaran.title: Why a Catamaran Is the Best Way to Sail Phuket

space.title: Spacious Decks, Smooth Sailing & Modern Design
space.p1: The twin-hull design creates nearly double the usable deck space of a monohull of similar length. Wide bow trampolines, a shaded cockpit dining area, and a stern swim platform mean your group is never crowded into one spot. The shallow draft is a real advantage around Phuket's limestone islands too — catamarans can anchor in protected bays and turquoise lagoons that deeper-keeled vessels simply can't reach.

safety.title: Ideal Safety & Balance of Performance and Relaxation
safety.p1: Catamarans are among the safest vessels on the water. Twin hulls make them virtually impossible to capsize, their wide beam stays stable in choppy conditions, and children can move around the deck freely without the constant tipping of monohull sailing. This matters especially in Phuket, where overcrowded speedboat tours remain the common alternative — a private catamaran charter means controlled speeds, professional crew, proper safety equipment, and the freedom to adjust your route if conditions change.

alternative.title: A Refined Alternative to Standard Phuket Boat Charters
alternative.p1: Most Phuket boat charters fall into two categories: budget speedboats that prioritise volume over comfort, or superyachts that price out most travellers. A catamaran sits in the sweet spot — genuinely luxurious, beautifully designed, and fully crewed, but accessible to couples, families, and friend groups who want something special without spending five figures a night.

cta2.title: Phuket's Peak Sailing Season: November–April
cta2.text: The Andaman Sea's calmest waters, clearest visibility, and steadiest breezes fall between November and April. Christmas, New Year, and Chinese New Year charters book out 2–3 months ahead. If your dates are flexible, shoulder months (November, April) offer the best availability and value.

charterOptions.multiDayInfo: Popular multi-day routes include: Phi Phi and Koh Lanta (2–3 nights), Koh Rok and Koh Ha (3–4 nights), and the ultimate expedition south to Koh Lipe and the Butang Archipelago (5–7 nights).

A catamaran's shallow draft lets you anchor inside Pileh Lagoon where larger vessels can't enter — and overnight stays mean you experience Phi Phi after the speedboats leave.

phangNga.title: Catamaran Charter Phang Nga Bay & Dramatic Limestone Landscapes
phangNga.description: Vertical limestone karsts rising from emerald water, James Bond Island, hidden sea caves, and traditional floating villages. Kayak through collapsed cave systems into secret hongs (lagoons) that are only accessible at certain tides. Phang Nga Bay is calmer than open-sea destinations, making it ideal for families and first-time sailors.

racha.description1: The Racha Islands (Racha Yai and Racha Noi) offer Phuket's closest premium anchorage — crystal-clear water, healthy coral reefs, and calm bays that are perfect for snorkeling, kayaking, and paddleboarding. racha.description2: After day-trip boats depart by mid-afternoon, overnight catamaran guests have entire beaches to themselves. Explore hidden coves along Racha Yai's eastern coast, swim through natural rock formations, and enjoy sunset from anchorages with no other boats in sight.

skippers.title: Professional Skippers with Local Andaman Sea Knowledge
skippers.content: Every catamaran charter includes a licensed Thai skipper with deep knowledge of the Andaman Sea — tidal patterns, seasonal weather shifts, the best anchorages for each time of day, and quiet snorkeling spots that don't appear in tourist guides. With 30 years of collective experience, our captains adjust routes in real time to ensure you get the best conditions and the most rewarding sailing experience.

comfort.title: Comfortable Cabins, Bathrooms & Shaded Lounge Areas
comfort.p1: Our catamarans feature 3–4 private cabins with queen or double beds, ensuite bathrooms with hot-water showers, and ample storage. Above deck, shaded cockpit areas provide comfortable dining and lounging space protected from the sun, while open foredeck trampolines and swim platforms give you direct access to the water.

meals.title: Freshly Prepared Thai Meals, Drinks & Catering Options
meals.p1: Your onboard chef prepares every meal fresh from local ingredients. Expect authentic Thai cuisine — green curry, pad thai, tom yum soup, fresh seafood, and tropical fruits — alongside international options on request. Beach BBQs on secluded shores are a highlight of overnight charters.
meals.p2: All dietary preferences are accommodated: vegetarian, vegan, halal, gluten-free, and allergy-specific menus. For celebrations, we arrange custom cakes, premium seafood platters, and champagne service with advance notice.

honeymoon.title: Honeymoons & Romantic Sailing Escapes Phuket

Secluded anchorages, sunset dinners on deck, champagne service, and mornings waking up in deserted bays create an intimacy that no resort can match. family.p1: Catamarans are the most family-friendly charter option in Phuket. The wide, stable deck means kids can move freely. Shallow protected bays provide safe swimming. Snorkeling gear, kayaks, and paddleboards keep children entertained for hours. And with a professional crew handling sailing, cooking, and safety, parents actually get to relax.

celebrations.title: Celebrations at Sea Without the Crowds in Phuket

Around Phuket's limestone islands — particularly Phi Phi's Pileh Lagoon, Koh Hong's inner lagoon, and the sheltered coves of Racha Yai — this translates into dramatically better anchorage positions and more private beach access.

calm.p1: Monohulls are built for performance sailing — exciting for experienced sailors, but the constant heel and motion can be uncomfortable for guests who just want to relax. cost.q: How much does a catamaran charter cost in Phuket?
cost.a: Day charters start from €800. Overnight catamaran charters from €1,000/night. Premium air-conditioned catamarans from €2,500/night. All prices include crew, meals, fuel, and activities — no hidden fees.

guests.q: How many guests can a catamaran accommodate?
guests.a: Our catamarans have 3–4 private cabins accommodating up to 8 overnight guests. For day charters, we can host up to 10–12 guests depending on the vessel. Every booking is private — you won't share with strangers.

experience.q: Do I need sailing experience to charter a catamaran?
experience.a: Not at all. Every crewed catamaran charter includes a licensed skipper who handles all sailing. You're free to participate or simply relax. For experienced sailors, we also offer bareboat catamaran charters (valid license required).

children.a: Yes — catamarans are the safest and most family-friendly charter option. The wide, stable platform means very little motion, safety railings and netting are standard, and life jackets are provided for all ages. Our crews are experienced with families and keep kids engaged with water activities.

difference.q: What's the difference between a catamaran and a monohull charter?
difference.a: Catamarans are wider, more stable, and have more deck and cabin space. They don't heel (lean) under sail, making them far more comfortable for guests who aren't experienced sailors. They also have shallower drafts, allowing access to anchorages and lagoons monohulls can't reach.

islands.q: Which islands can I visit on a catamaran from Phuket?
islands.a: Day trips: Phi Phi Islands, Racha Islands, Phang Nga Bay, Koh Hong. Multi-day: Koh Lanta, Koh Rok, Koh Ha, Similan Islands, Koh Lipe. Your itinerary is fully customizable.

included.q: What's included in the charter price?
included.a: Professional crew, all meals, drinking water, fuel, mooring, snorkeling gear, kayaks, paddleboards, safety equipment, and accident insurance. National park fees and alcoholic beverages are extra.

bestTime.q: When is the best time for a catamaran charter in Phuket?
bestTime.a: November to April offers the best conditions — calm seas, clear skies, and steady sailing winds. December to March is peak season and books earliest. For quieter waters and lower prices, November and April are excellent shoulder months.

advance.q: How far in advance should I book?
advance.a: Peak season (Dec–Mar): 2–4 weeks minimum. Christmas/New Year: 2–3 months recommended. For the best catamaran selection, booking early is always worthwhile — especially for multi-day charters.

weather.q: What if the weather is bad?
weather.a: We reschedule for free, suggest alternative sheltered routes, or provide a full refund if we cancel for safety reasons. Our skippers monitor conditions constantly and will always prioritize your safety and comfort.

what.q: What is a luxury sailing yacht charter in Phuket?
what.a: A fully private charter — a premium sailing yacht or catamaran, professional crew, chef, and full equipment — reserved exclusively for your group. You choose the islands, the pace, and the duration. Everything else is handled.

difference.q: How is a luxury sailing charter different from a superyacht charter in Phuket?
difference.a: Luxury sailing charters focus on authentic wind-powered sailing aboard premium catamarans and yachts — intimate, adventure-oriented, and ideal for couples, honeymooners, and small groups seeking a genuine sailing experience. Superyacht charters in Phuket involve larger motor yachts (70–106ft+) suited to VIP events, corporate entertaining, and ultra-luxury occasions. Both offer exceptional quality — the right choice depends entirely on the experience you're after.

honeymoon.q: What is the best luxury sailing charter for a honeymoon in Phuket?
honeymoon.a: A 3–5 night private catamaran charter. A private ensuite cabin, fresh meals each day, and a route that covers Phi Phi Islands, Racha Islands, and Koh Rok — secluded, beautiful, and completely private. Tell us it's your honeymoon when you inquire and we'll arrange the right touches onboard.

islands.q: Which islands can I reach on a luxury sailing charter from Phuket?
islands.a: On day and overnight charters: Racha Islands (2–3 hrs), Phi Phi Islands (4–5 hrs), Phang Nga Bay and Koh Hong (3–4 hrs). On 5+ night charters: Koh Rok, Koh Ha, Koh Lanta, and Koh Lipe.

firstTime.q: Is a luxury sailing charter suitable for first-time sailors?
firstTime.a: Yes. All crewed charters include a professional captain who handles all sailing and navigation. You need no experience — just an interest in the sea and the islands.

included.q: What is included in a luxury sailing charter in Phuket?
included.a: All meals, drinking water, fuel, crew (captain, chef, deckhand), snorkeling gear, kayaks, and paddleboards. National park fees (300–400 THB per person per park) and alcoholic drinks are typically extra — confirmed upfront with no surprises.

bestTime.q: When is the best time for a luxury sailing charter in Phuket?
bestTime.a: November to April offers the calmest conditions and most reliable weather. Low season (May–October) brings 30–40% lower prices and quieter anchorages — perfectly viable for guests comfortable with occasional afternoon rain.

cost.q: How much does a luxury sailing charter in Phuket cost?
cost.a: Private luxury sailing charters start from approximately €700–€900 per night for premium catamarans. Day charters from 29,900 THB. All inclusive of crew, meals, and onboard activities.

Whether you're lounging on deck under the sun or enjoying a quiet moment in your cabin, you'll find plenty of time to unwind while exploring Thailand's stunning coastal beauty.

destinations.title: Island Destinations on a Phuket Cabin Sail

phiPhi.title: Phi Phi Islands and Koh Phi Phi Leh Sailing
phiPhi.description:
The Phi Phi Islands are a must-see destination on any cabin cruise in Phuket. Known for their towering limestone cliffs, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant coral reefs, these islands offer the perfect combination of natural beauty and adventure. The shallow draft of our ships allows us to anchor in secluded lagoons like Pileh Lagoon, where larger boats can't reach, ensuring that you have a more exclusive experience.
A cabin cruise in Phi Phi means you can enjoy famous spots like Maya Bay (featured in The Beach) and Monkey Beach without the crowds. Experience the islands at sunrise or sunset, when the landscapes are at their most tranquil and breathtaking.
phiPhi.details: 4–5 hours sailing from Chalong Bay | Day trip or overnight

phangNga.title: Phang Nga Bay and Limestone Landscapes Sailing
phangNga.description:
Phang Nga Bay is one of Thailand's most iconic landscapes, with its dramatic vertical limestone karsts rising from emerald green waters. On a cabin cruise sailing, you'll have the opportunity to kayak through hidden sea caves and explore secret hongs (lagoons) that can only be accessed at certain tides.
The calm waters and shallow depth of the bay make it perfect for those looking to enjoy a peaceful and relaxed sailing experience. James Bond Island, one of the bay's most famous spots, is a highlight of the journey. Spend the day exploring this stunning natural landscape, before anchoring in a quiet bay for the night.
phangNga.details: 3–4 hours sailing from Chalong Bay | Perfect for day charters

bays.title: Beautiful Bays Around Southern Thailand Sailing
bays.description:
Southern Thailand offers some of the most pristine beaches and turquoise waters in the world. On your cabin cruise sailing, you can visit secluded bays that are often inaccessible by larger boats. Enjoy swimming, sunbathing, or simply relaxing on the white sandy beaches, with no other tourists around.
The bays around Phuket are perfect for water activities like snorkeling, kayaking, and paddleboarding. Explore vibrant coral reefs, swim with colorful fish, and enjoy calm anchorages that offer the perfect setting for a peaceful day at sea.
bays.details: 4–6 hours sailing from Chalong Bay | Ideal for families and small groups

design.title: Stable Twin-Hulled Sailing Design
design.description:
The twin-hull design of our ships ensures a stable, smooth sailing experience, making them the perfect choice for guests who want a comfortable journey without the motion of traditional monohull vessels. The stability of the cabin cruise allows you to relax on deck, enjoy meals without distraction, and experience a serene voyage.
Unlike monohulls that tilt and roll, our ships sit flat on the water, ensuring a more relaxing, comfortable ride for all guests, including families with children or those prone to seasickness.

decks.title: Spacious Decks for Dining and Relaxation
decks.description:
Our ships boast large, spacious decks that are perfect for dining, lounging, and enjoying the stunning views. Whether you're enjoying a meal with your group, soaking in the sun, or relaxing with a drink in hand, the spacious decks provide a comfortable environment for all your needs.
The shaded dining area offers respite from the sun, while the open stern is ideal for enjoying the sea breeze or taking a dip from the swim platforms. There's plenty of room for everyone, whether you prefer to relax in private or socialize with fellow passengers.

accessible.description: A cabin cruise provides an affordable alternative to booking a private yacht, while still offering a luxury experience. shared.title: Shared Costs Without Compromising Comfort

crew.title: Professional Crew and Planned Routes Included
crew.description: Every cabin cruise includes a full crew, including a professional skipper, onboard chef, and support staff, ensuring you have a seamless experience from start to finish. With pre-planned routes and flexible itineraries, you can rest assured that every detail will be taken care of, leaving you to focus on enjoying the beauty of the Andaman Sea.

cost.q: How much does a cabin cruise in Phuket cost?
cost.a: Day cabin cruises start from €1,199. Overnight cabin cruises from €1,500/night. Multi-day cabin cruises from €2,500/night. All prices include crew, meals, activities, and onboard amenities — no hidden fees.

guests.q: How many guests can a cabin cruise accommodate?
guests.a: Our cabin cruises offer 3–4 private cabins, accommodating up to 8 overnight guests. For day cruises, we can host up to 10-12 guests depending on the vessel. Every booking is private — you won't share with strangers, ensuring an intimate experience.

experience.q: Do I need sailing experience to join a cabin cruise?
experience.a: Not at all. Every cabin cruise includes a professional crew, including a licensed skipper, chef, and support staff who handle all sailing and operations. You're free to participate in the sailing or simply relax and enjoy the journey.

children.q: Are cabin cruises safe for children?
children.a: Yes — cabin cruises are among the safest options for families. The stable twin-hull design ensures minimal motion, which is perfect for families with young children. Safety railings, netting, and life jackets for all ages are provided. Our experienced crew ensures kids are entertained and safe during water activities.

difference.q: What's the difference between a cabin cruise and a private yacht charter?
difference.a: A cabin cruise offers a shared, yet luxurious sailing experience at a more accessible price. You get the comfort of private cabins, gourmet meals, and a professional crew, but at a fraction of the cost of booking an entire private yacht. A cabin cruise provides a high-end experience with shared costs, making it ideal for small groups or solo travelers seeking luxury without the premium price tag.

islands.q: Which islands can I visit on a cabin cruise from Phuket?
islands.a: Day trips: Phi Phi Islands, Racha Islands, Phang Nga Bay, Koh Hong. Multi-day trips: Koh Lanta, Koh Rok, Koh Ha, Similan Islands, Koh Lipe, and more. Your itinerary is customizable to your preferences — explore at your own pace!

included.q: What's included in the cabin cruise price?
included.a: The price includes: Professional crew (licensed skipper, chef, and support staff), private cabins with ensuite bathrooms, meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner), water activities (snorkeling, paddleboarding, kayaking), onboard comforts (air conditioning, comfortable lounges, etc.). Not included: National park fees (300–400 THB per adult per park) and alcoholic beverages.

bestTime.q: When is the best time for a cabin cruise in Phuket?
bestTime.a: The best time for a cabin cruise in Phuket is from November to April, when the weather is calm and the skies are clear. This period offers the calmest waters, the best visibility, and the steadiest winds for sailing. For quieter experiences and lower prices, November and April (shoulder months) are great options.

booking.q: How far in advance should I book a cabin cruise?
booking.a: During peak season (December–March), it's recommended to book at least 2–4 weeks in advance. For Christmas and New Year, we suggest booking 2–3 months ahead. For the best selection, booking early is always recommended, especially for multi-day cabin cruises.

cost.q: How much does an overnight sailing charter cost in Phuket?
cost.a: Overnight sailing charters in Phuket start at €1,000 per night for a mid-range catamaran. Luxury catamarans and yachts range from €2,500 to €5,000 per night, depending on the vessel size and amenities. Prices typically include crew, meals, water activities, and fuel.

islands.q: What islands can I visit on an overnight sailing charter from Phuket?
islands.a: You can visit some of the most beautiful islands in Thailand, including Phi Phi Islands, Koh Lanta, Koh Rok, Koh Ha, Koh Lipe, and the Similan Islands. These destinations offer stunning beaches, vibrant coral reefs, and serene anchorages, all easily accessible on an overnight sailing charter.

nights.q: How many nights do you recommend for overnight sailing in Phuket?
nights.a: A 3–4 night charter is ideal for a comprehensive experience, allowing you to explore multiple islands, including Phi Phi, Koh Lanta, and Koh Rok. If you're short on time, a 1–2 night charter is great for a quick getaway, while a 5-night or longer charter is perfect for a deeper exploration of remote islands like Koh Lipe and the Similan Islands.

included.q: What is included in an overnight sailing charter in Phuket?
included.a: An overnight sailing charter includes a licensed skipper, chef, and deckhand. All meals, snorkeling gear, kayaks, and paddleboards are provided. Prices also cover fuel, mooring, and accident insurance, ensuring a stress-free sailing experience. National park fees and alcoholic beverages are typically extra.

honeymoon.q: Is overnight sailing in Phuket good for a honeymoon?
honeymoon.a: Yes, overnight sailing in Phuket is an excellent choice for honeymooners. It offers privacy, romantic sunsets, and secluded anchorages. You can enjoy private dinners on deck, sunrise views, and intimate moments, making it a memorable and unique experience compared to traditional resorts.

typicalDay.q: What is a typical day like on an overnight sailing charter in Phuket?
typicalDay.a: A typical day starts with a relaxing breakfast at anchor, followed by sailing to your next destination. You'll have time for snorkeling, swimming, and exploring remote beaches. As the day ends, enjoy a candlelit dinner while watching the sunset, followed by a peaceful night at anchor, and waking up to a new, serene location.

safety.q: Is overnight sailing in Phuket safe?
safety.a: Yes, overnight sailing in Phuket is very safe. The catamarans we use are stable, and licensed captains are experienced in navigating the Andaman Sea. We also provide safety equipment and ensure your journey is comfortable and secure, with a crew that can handle any situation.

vsCabin.q: What is the difference between an overnight sailing charter and a cabin cruise in Phuket?
vsCabin.a: An overnight sailing charter provides a private, customizable experience with a crew dedicated solely to you and your group. In contrast, a cabin cruise typically involves shared accommodations with other guests and a fixed itinerary. With an overnight sailing charter, you enjoy more flexibility, privacy, and a tailored experience.

similan.q: Can I reach the Similan Islands on an overnight sailing charter from Phuket?
similan.a: Yes, the Similan Islands are accessible on 5+ night sailing charters from Phuket. These islands are renowned for their diving and snorkeling opportunities, featuring vibrant coral reefs and clear waters. Longer charters allow you to explore these remote, protected areas and enjoy their pristine beauty.

food.q: What food is served on overnight sailing charters in Phuket?
food.a: On an overnight sailing charter, meals are freshly prepared by your onboard chef. Expect authentic Thai dishes like pad thai, green curry, and tom yum soup, along with fresh seafood and tropical fruits. Special dietary requests, such as vegetarian, vegan, or gluten-free options, are also accommodated.
